item.title: Renaming a Terraform module is dangerous
item.description: As the state file uses the module name in identifiers and so a module rename causes Terraform to think all existing resources need to be destroyed and recreated. You can avoid such needless destruction by editing the state file manually to correct the identifiers. It might be possible to use terraform mv although I didn’t use that approach today.
